translations.translation: Who hinders men from (doing) good, the transgressor, the iniquitous,
the hinderer of good, the transgressor, the sinful;
One who excessively forbids the good, transgressor, sinner.
Hinderer of the good, transgressor, sinful,
Forbidder of good, outstepping the limits, sinful,
hinderer of good, guilty aggressor, coarse-grained,
Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor
or to one who places obstacles in the way of good being done or to the wicked transgressor,
Hinderer of the good, trespasser; sinner.
hinderer of all good, sinful transgressor,
(Habitually) hindering (all) good, transgressing beyond bounds, deep in sin,
Hinderer of the good, transgressor, sinful,
those who hinder good, the guilty aggressor,
A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
[68:12] hinderer of good, niggardly with his wealth against deserving causes, sinful transgressor, wrongdoer,

(Hinderer of the good) hinderer of Islam, for he prevented his sons and relatives from embracing Islam, (transgressor) he transgressed, Muhammad, against the Truth and wronged them, (malefactor) sinful

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ } شحيح بخيل لا ينفق من ماله على من يستحقه، ويمنع أيضاً صاحبه وصديقه عن الإنفاق؛ لئلا يلحق العار عليه خاصة { مُعْتَدٍ } مجاوز الحد في أنواع الظلم، وأصناف الفسوق والعصيان { أَثِيمٍ } [القلم: 12] مبالغ في اقتراف الإثمَّ والعدوان بلا مبالاة
